channel.title: How do you remove the "Must have client" Requirement?
channel.description: Hi i have just downloaded a new source to use but iv noticed alot of people try and join but can't because they don't have the client. I have been searching in client.java but havent seen it and im not sure if im looking in the right place. If some one knows how please help. :)

item.title: How do you remove the "Must have client" Requirement?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

If you don’t have anything saying UID than it has to be the server.ini make sure client required = 0
Sorry I misread and thought you wanted to add. I’ve been misreading a lot lately.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you remove the "Must have client" Requirement?

@mangalover51 wrote:

then that means pretty much take out what they just said to add then… simple…

item.source: How do you remove the "Must have client" Requirement?

item.title: How do you remove the "Must have client" Requirement?
item.dc:creator: @_icestorm ~*icestorm*~
item.description:
@_icestorm wrote:

[quote=“lary370, post:8, topic:333906”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=430303.msg3160149#msg3160149 date=1269466613]
Ok. Open Signlink.java (client sided)
Find UID =
Assign it a value you can remember. Ill use 435 for this example.

uid = 435;

Than go into Client.java(Server side) and find

int UID = inStream.readDWord();

Under that add

if(UID != 435) { System.out.println("Invalid UID - Client Disconnected."); disconnected = true; destruct(); }

And thats all you have to do.
[/quote]

Lol? thats how to add it…[/quote]
Yeh im not trying to add one im trying to remove a existing one.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you remove the "Must have client" Requirement?

item.title: How do you remove the "Must have client" Requirement?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Ok. Open Signlink.java (client sided)
Find UID =
Assign it a value you can remember. Ill use 435 for this example.

uid = 435;

Than go into Client.java(Server side) and find

int UID = inStream.readDWord();

Under that add

if(UID != 435) { System.out.println("Invalid UID - Client Disconnected."); disconnected = true; destruct(); }

And thats all you have to do.

item.title: How do you remove the "Must have client" Requirement?
item.dc:creator: @_icestorm ~*icestorm*~
item.description:
@_icestorm wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:333906”]Depends. It might be in server.ini, or it may be the UID in client.java.[/quote]I have server.ini but it doesnt work because it’s enforceing the wrong client. (its set to 0 when i set it to 1 it won’t let anyone on) Im using Evulution X base idk if that helps. If you know how to do this please help as this is the first server iv had that requires you to have the client.

Read full topic
